001package com.technototes.library.command;
002
003import androidx.annotation.Nullable;
004
005import java.util.function.BooleanSupplier;
006
007/** Simple class for commands that require a certain condition to be true to run
008 *
009 * This encapsulates *two* different capabilities.
010 * 1. A ConditionalCommand with only a condition, but no commands, is a a "wait" command.
011 *    It will only finish once the condition is true.
012 * 2. A ConditionalCommand with a condition and a true (and optionally false) command
013 *    is a generic "if/else" command: If the condition is true, execute the 'true command',
014 *    if not true, execute the 'false command' if it is supplied.
015 *
016 * TODO: This makes the class a little clunky. It wouldn't be terrible to break the functionality
017 * TODO: out into multiple classes instead
018 * @author Alex Stedman
019 */
020public class ConditionalCommand implements Command {
021    private BooleanSupplier supplier;
022    @Nullable private Command trueCommand, falseCommand;
023
024    /** This makes a "wait" command
025     *
026     * @param condition The BooleanSupplier that will be waited upon until true
027     */
028    public ConditionalCommand(BooleanSupplier condition) {
029        supplier = condition;
030        trueCommand = null;
031        falseCommand = null;
032    }
033
034    /** Make a conditional command
035     *
036     * @param condition The condition
037     * @param command The command to run when the condition is true.
038     */
039    public ConditionalCommand(BooleanSupplier condition, Command command) {
040        supplier = condition;
041        trueCommand = command;
042        CommandScheduler.getInstance().scheduleWithOther(this, trueCommand, condition);
043        falseCommand = null;
044    }
045
046    /** Make a conditional command
047     *
048     * @param condition The condition
049     * @param trueC The command to run when the condition is true
050     * @param falseC The command to run when the condition is false
051     */
052    public ConditionalCommand(BooleanSupplier condition, Command trueC, Command falseC) {
053        supplier = condition;
054        trueCommand = trueC;
055        falseCommand = falseC;
056        CommandScheduler.getInstance().scheduleWithOther(this, trueCommand, condition);
057        CommandScheduler.getInstance().scheduleWithOther(this, falseCommand, () -> !condition.getAsBoolean());
058    }
059
060    @Override
061    public void execute() {}
062
063    @Override
064    public boolean isFinished() {
065        if (trueCommand == null) return supplier.getAsBoolean();
066        if (falseCommand == null) return trueCommand.justFinished();
067        return trueCommand.justFinished() || falseCommand.justFinished();
068    }
069}
